Built-in widgets¶

class src.widgets.hardware.HardwareData(_name, _date=datetime.datetime(2019, 9, 19, 20, 29, 29, 544217), _value=0)¶

Piece of data from a specific hardware or a harware specification.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the data (it could be the hardware itself of a spec from the hardware)

  • date (date) – The date and time of the data retrieval

  • value (int/float) – The value behind the data

get_date()¶

Return the date when the snapshot was taken

get_name()¶

Return the name of the data

get_value()¶

Return the value behind the data

set_value(_value)¶

This method is used to set the data from a given time

class src.widgets.cpu.CPUModel¶

Hardware Model representation of the CPU. It contains and sends to the database the following datas:

  • cpu_nbr_cores

  • cpu_core_x_freq

  • cpu_core_x_max_freq

display_cpu_cores_freq()¶

Temporary method to display the CPU State - Frequency and % Frequency

get_cores()¶

Return the list of cores

get_is_valid()¶

Return True if the data is considered as valid

get_nbr_cores()¶

Return the number of cores from the CPU

refresh_cores()¶

Refreshing the list of cores on each data update

set_cores(_cores)¶

Set a list of cores commonly to the number of cores from the CPU

set_is_valid(_is_valid)¶

Set True if the data is considered as valid, False if there’s an error during the data retrieval.

set_nbr_cores(_nbr_cores)¶

Set the number of cores from the CPU
